content_markdown:
To export Salesforce report to Excel, you can simply click on the export button to choose between a summarized or detailed view. In this article we will explore how to export data or exporting a complete list of reports to Excel.

Simply click on the dropdown icon next to “Edit” button and then click “Export.”

![Export Salesforce report to Excel](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-2-png.webp)

#### Export Summary Report file

Choose the Formatted Report to export your summarized report exactly as it exists visually in Salesforce. The Excel file will contain formatting. Because the output is formatted, Excel is the only option for formatted reports.

#### Export a Details Only file

Choose the Details Only option to export the detailed data within your report (summarized) to an Excel or CSV file. If you do not have a summarized report, the “Details Only” button is the only option.

![Salesforce report export options](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-1-png.webp)

[Video: Export Salesforce report to excel and csv](https://www.youtube.com/embed/eKNSbuRTXw8?feature=oembed)

## Schedule your export Salesforce report to excel

Salesforce offers for reports a subscription mechanism that allows you schedule emails containing Excel data to yourself and other users.

Click on the dropdown icon next to “Edit” button and then click “Subscribe.”

![Salesforce report subscribe](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-3-png.webp)

Click the “Attach file” button to select Formatted Report or Detail Only format.

Select the recipients who will receive the report.

As notated by Salesforce, the other recipients of the data files will see the report as the person who subscribes. This is particularly important if your access to data is different then other recipients.

![Salesforce subscribe details](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-4-png.webp)

## Export Salesforce Report and Dashboard List

To export a list of reports from Salesforce, you can create a Salesforce report of reports as shown below. Then, you can utilize the same steps covered in this article to export the list to Excel.

![Salesforce report of reports](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-5-1024x301.webp)

To create a Salesforce Report of Reports, create a new report and select the “Reports” type. Salesforce provides 8 standard fields.

![Salesforce Reports standard report type](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-6-1024x247.webp)

With your report built, you can export the list of reports to Excel or CSV.

![Export reports from Salesforce](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-2-png.webp)
